166.text:

skin.
Conference, I could easily spend all my time

And they are not a state. Their actions have

1065.text:

The extremists believe in a clash of civilisations

citizens, regardless of their gender, ethnicity,

This hateful ideology has nothing to do with

So let the message go out from this hall that

1359.text:

1374.text:

1425.text:
Since the start of this year, the police have

of terrorist material. We have an established

1437.text: who are drifting into extremism and violence.

We have made important changes to the ‘Prevent’

1464.text:

of Human Rights – I’ve kicked a few of

1570.text:

Across 
the country, there are concerns about the

1689.text:
We 
must be clear to people that the United Kingdom
is a great place to live. We choose to live

1701.text:
here, immigrants come to live here, and many
dream of building a life here because we have

1707.text:
a free society. We celebrate different ways

1714.text: our freedom to lead our lives as we choose.

1720.text:
All British people – including British Muslims
– are free to practise their faith, and

1726.text:
wear whatever clothes they choose. They are
free to establish their own faith schools

But the whole point of living in such a society

1751.text:

1769.text:

other people’s right to do so too. And you

The rule of law. Democracy. Equality. Free

speech. And respect for minorities. These

1790.text:

1797.text:

1811.text:
But to live in a modern liberal state is not
to live in a moral vacuum. We have to stand

1818.text:
up for our values as a nation. There will,
I know, be some who say that what I describe

1824.text:

But if others described a woman’s intellect

1830.text:

1835.text:
the democratic process, we would quite rightly

1842.text:
who say I am wrong to link these kinds of

1847.text:
we must confront. To them I say, yes, not
all extremism leads to violence. And not all

1856.text:
extremists are violent. But the damage extremists

1864.text:
And there is, undoubtedly, a thread that binds
the kind of extremism that promotes intolerance,

1872.text:
hatred and a sense of superiority over others
to the actions of those who want to impose

1878.text: their values on us through violence.

1882.text:
Those extremists are dangerous but they are
a small minority. We know the overwhelming

1889.text:
majority of British people want to be free.
Free from danger. Free from fear. Free from

1898.text:
prejudice. Free from discrimination. Free
to practise their religion. Free to observe

their cultures and traditions. Free to dress
as they like. Free to be educated as they

1911.text:
choose. Free to work where they wish. Free
to live with whom they love. Free to raise

1916.text:
their families as they see fit. Free to get

1930.text:
We must not become a society where these things

1938.text:
